channel.title: Gateway KVM to specific NIC
channel.description:
Hi, I have the whonix gateway running on debian with KVM.
The host has two network interfaces and I want that the Whonix Gateway to communicate only via one specific NIC.
Atm it is in NAT mode and communicates via the wrong NIC.
How can I set the whonix external network to a specific NIC ? Would this cause safety problems ?

item.title: Gateway KVM to specific NIC
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
This needs creating a network bridge. Some laptop NICs may not support that YMMV. No it shouldn’t be dangerous.

Bobcares – 8 Oct 20

How to configure network bridge for KVM virtual machines in Linux

There are many ways to configure network bridge for KVM virtual machines. By default, the Virtual Machine launched in KVM uses a NAT network.
